dhp167-178:167: Follow not the vulgar way; live not in heedlessness; hold not false views; linger not long in worldly existence.
dhp167-178:168: Arise! Do not be heedless! Lead a righteous life. The righteous live happily both in this world and the next.
dhp167-178:169: Lead a righteous life; lead not a base life. The righteous live happily both in this world and the next.
dhp167-178:170: One who looks upon the world as a bubble and a mirage, him the King of Death sees not.
dhp167-178:171: Come! Behold this world, which is like a decorated royal chariot. Here fools flounder, but the wise have no attachment to it.
dhp167-178:172: He who having been heedless is heedless no more, illuminates this world like the moon freed from clouds.
dhp167-178:173: He, who by good deeds covers the evil he has done, illuminates this world like the moon freed from clouds.
dhp167-178:174: Blind is the world; here only a few possess insight. Only a few, like birds escaping from the net, go to realms of bliss.
dhp167-178:175: Swans fly on the path of the sun; men pass through the air by psychic powers; the wise are led away from the world after vanquishing MƒÅra and his host.
dhp167-178:176: For a liar who has violated the one law (of truthfulness) who holds in scorn the hereafter, there is no evil that he cannot do.
dhp167-178:177: Truly, misers fare not to heavenly realms; nor, indeed, do fools praise generosity. But the wise man rejoices in giving, and by that alone does he become happy hereafter.
dhp167-178:178: Better than sole sovereignty over the earth, better than going to heaven, better even than lordship over all the worlds is the supramundane Fruition of Stream Entrance.
